input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Update Telecommunication Device
This wrapper updates Telecommunication Device record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>update-telecommunication-device</operation-name> <model> <keys> <configuration-item> <value>MyTelecommunicationDevice001</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item>
</keys> <instance> <device> <configuration-item> <value>MyTelecommunicationDevice001</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <vendor> <value>Vendor</value> <type>String</type> </vendor> <parent-device> <value>parent device</value> <type>String</type> </parent-device> <model> <value>model</value> <type>String</type> </model> <serial-number> <value>Serial Number</value> <type>String</type> </serial-number> <location> <value>Location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <configuration-item-type> <value>telecom</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item-type> <updated-by> <value>falcon</value> <type>String</type> </updated-by> <contact-name> <value>Contact Name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> <part-number> <value>Part Number</value> <type>String</type> </part-number> <status> <value>status</value> <type>String</type> </status> <configuration-item-sub-type> <value>Desk Phone</value> <type>string</type> </configuration-item-sub-type> <location-code> <value>location code</value> <type>String</type> </location-code> <building> <value>building</value> <type>String</type> </building> <floor> <value>floor</value> <type>String</type> </floor> <room> <value>room</value> <type>String</type> </room> <system-down> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </system-down> <asset-tag> <value>asset tag</value> <type>String</type> </asset-tag> <critical> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </critical> <company> <value>comapany</value> <type>String</type> </company> <department> <value>department</value> <type /> </department> <assignment-group> <value>assignment-group</value> <type>String</type> </assignment-group> <addl> <type>Array</type> <addl> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>Structure</type> <addl-manufacturer> <value>addl manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </addl-manufacturer> <addl-name> <value>addl name</value> <type>String</type> </addl-name> <addl-type> <value>addl type</value> <type>String</type> </addl-type> <addl-description> <value>addl description</value> <type>String</type> </addl-description> </element> <element> <type>Structure</type> <addl-manufacturer> <value>addl manufacturer2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-manufacturer> <addl-name> <value>addl name2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-name> <addl-type> <value>addl type2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-type> <addl-description> <value>addl description2</value> <type>String</type> </addl-description> </element> </addl> </addl> <scans> <type>array</type> <scans> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <scan-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </scan-date> <scan-type> <value>scran type</value> <type>String</type> </scan-type> <scan-version> <value>scran version</value> <type>String</type> </scan-version> <scan-result> <value>scran result</value> <type>String</type> </scan-result> </element> <element> <type>structure</type> <scan-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </scan-date> <scan-type> <value>scran type2</value> <type>String</type> </scan-type> <scan-version> <value>scran version2</value> <type>String</type> </scan-version> <scan-result> <value>scran result2</value> <type>String</type> </scan-result> </element> </scans> </scans> <support-contacts> <type>array</type> <support-contacts> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <support-contact-name> <value>supoort contact name</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-name> <support-contact-reason> <value>suport contact reason</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-reason> <support-contact-first> <value>suport contact first</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-first> <support-contact-last> <value>support contact last</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-last> <support-contact-phone> <value>support contact phone</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-phone> <support-contact-email> <value>supooet contact email</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-email> </element> <element> <type>structure</type> <support-contact-name> <value>supoort contact name1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-name> <support-contact-reason> <value>suport contact reason1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-reason> <support-contact-first> <value>suport contact first1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-first> <support-contact-last> <value>support contact last1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-last> <support-contact-phone> <value>support contact phone1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-phone> <support-contact-email> <value>supooet contact email1</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-email> </element> </support-contacts> </support-contacts> <features> <type>array</type> <features> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <feature-id> <value>feature id</value> <type>String</type> </feature-id> <feature-size> <value>100</value> <type>decimal</type> </feature-size> <feature-description> <value>feature description</value> <type>String</type> </feature-description> </element> </features> </features> </device> <telecommunication-device> <type>Structure</type> <configuration-item> <value>MyTelecommunicationDevice001</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <drivers> <type>Array</type> <drivers> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>Structure</type> <driver-name> <value>driver name</value> <type>String</type> </driver-name> <driver-type> <value>driver type</value> <type>String</type> </driver-type> <driver-description> <value>driver description</value> <type>String</type> </driver-description> <driver-version> <value>driver version</value> <type>String</type> </driver-version> </element> </drivers> </drivers> <connections> <type>Array</type> <connections> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>Structure</type> <connection-name> <value>connection name</value> <type>String</type> </connection-name> <connection-type> <value>connectoin type</value> <type>String</type> </connection-type> <connection-ip-address> <value>connection ip address</value> <type>String</type> </connection-ip-address> <connection-mac-address> <value>Connection mac address</value> <type>String</type> </connection-mac-address> <connection-domain-suffix> <value>connection domain suffix</value> <type>String</type> </connection-domain-suffix> <connection-default-gateway> <value>connection default gateway</value> <type>String</type> </connection-default-gateway> <connection-subnet-mask> <value>connection subnet mask</value> <type>String</type> </connection-subnet-mask> <connection-device-id> <value>connection device id</value> <type>String</type> </connection-device-id> <connection-dhcp> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </connection-dhcp> <connection-description> <value>connection description</value> <type>String</type> </connection-description> <connection-speed> <value>1</value> <type>Deciaml</type> </connection-speed> <connection-media-interface> <value>connection media interface</value> <type>String</type> </connection-media-interface> </element> </connections> </connections> <ports> <type>array</type> <ports> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <port-name> <value>port name</value> <type>String</type> </port-name> <port-label> <value>port label</value> <type>String</type> </port-label> <port-connectivity> <value>port connectivity</value> <type>String</type> </port-connectivity> </element> </ports> </ports> <sysmodtime> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </sysmodtime> <sysmoduser> <value>falcon</value> <type>String</type> </sysmoduser> <sysmodcount> <value>6</value> <type>Decimal</type> </sysmodcount> </telecommunication-device> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description: Update Process takes place in following manner-
The record is first selected (located) by the information provided in the <keys> element. Essentially, you populate <keys> element with valid key elements otherwise the record wouldn’t be located.
Once the record is located properly, the fields are updated by the information provided in <instance> element. That is, the respective fields of located record are replaced by the elements’ values that are provided in <instance> element.
NOTE: While locating a record, complete matching of key is required. This means if you give key value to be “abc” and there is a record in the application repository which has key element as “abc123” then this record wouldn’t be located for the update (compare with Find Wrappers.)
Modification/Update in located record is done in following manner-
Suppose an random element with name <random-element> which has an 'fieldValue1'. i.e. on retrieving, we'll get.
<instance> ... ...
<random-element> <value>fieldValue1</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> ... ... </instance>
Now see following cases of updation-
Case-1: <instance> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide even the element <random-element> Result: the field get ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-2: <instance> <random-element> <value></value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide anything inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field get ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-3: <instance> <random-element> <value> </value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide an space character " " (or more contiguous space characters, like " ") inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field get's updated, and the field <random-elements> is set to blank ""(compare with space character " ".)
Case-4: <instance> <random-element> <value>fieldValue2</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide "fieldValue2" inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the value "fieldValue2" is set to field of <random-element>.
NOTE: One can update the key elements too.
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>update-telecommunication-device</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
configuration-item [Optional]: This is the name of the record. It must be unique as it’s used as key as well.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > Configuration Item
Valid Values: Any unique string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Vendor [Optional]: The vendor name.
Name of this element in the application: Vendor > Vendor Name.
Valid Values: Any string, or any existing vendor record.
Default Value: Ignored.
Parent-device[Optional]: The parent device name
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Model [Optional]: the model name.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Serial-number [Optional]: The serial number of the record.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > Serial Number
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Location [Optional]: location mapped by the record.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Location.
Valid Values: Any String or any existing location record.
Default Value: Ignored.
Configuration-item-type[Optional]: the type of the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: When we create any configuration item then at beginning level we’re asked for the type of configuration item. We have to select one of them. Like if we want to create display device then we should select that one. Other example might be computer, telecommunication device etc.
Also note that, these subtype are customizable. You can create new configuration item type in through the application.
Valid Values: Telecommunications
Default Value: Ignored.
Note: Avoid updating this field to another type, because it might cause some data lost.
Updated-by [Optional] : the name of the person that has updated the record.
Name of this element in the record: This is hidden field maintained by the record and is not visible to the application’s graphical interface. It has no use in the creation of the record process, but we can use this field during retrieving process.
Valid Values: Any string (during retrieving.)
Default Value: Ignored.
Contact-name [Optional]: the contact name.
Name of this element in the record: Contact > Contact Name
Valid Value: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default value: Ignored.
Part-number [Optional]: the part number.
Name of this element in the record: System Summary > Part Number”
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default value: Ignored.
Status[Optional] : the status of the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > Status
Valid Values: Any one string out of following set of strings
Installed Available Warehouse Transfer RMA Replaced Reserved Retired
Default Value: Ignored.
configuration-item-sub-type [Optional] : The subtype for a selected configuration item type.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > Subtype.
Valid Values: this is customizable and we can add/delete more subtypes. Currently there are following subtypes for the “computer” configuration item type.
Desk Phone Flush Wall Mount Headsets & Accessories NBX PBX Paging Solution Surface Mount
Default Value: Ignored.
Location-code[Optional]: The code for the location.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Building [Optional]: The building.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Building. Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Floor[Optional]: The floor related to the location.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Floor.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Room[Optional]: the room information.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Room.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
System-down[Optional]: this tell whether the system is down or not.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > System Down (Radio Button)
Valid Values: true/ false. True -> system is down, false -> system is not down.
Default Value: Ignored.
Asset-tag [Optional]: the asset tag for the record.
Name of this element in the record: System Summary > Asset Tag.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Critical[Optional]: this tell whether the record is critical or not.
Name of this element in the record: System Summary > Critical CI (Radio Button) Valid Values: true/ false.
True -> record is critical. False -> record is not critical.
Default value: Ignored.
Company[Optional]: Company name.
Name of this field in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Department[Optional]: the department information.
Name of this element in the record: System Summary > Department.
Valid Value: any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Default Value: Ignored.
Assignment-group[Optional]: the assignment group.
Name of this element in the record: Summary > Assignment
Valid Value: Any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Default Value: Ignored.
Addl[Optional]:
Note: all the successor elements of this element are NON-EXISTING.
The children of this elements keep information of other (additional) components.
Name of this element in the record: Components > Additional
Valid Values: as it’s array type, it must be structure in following manner-
<addl> <type>array</type> <addl> <!— children keeps information > </addl> </addl>
Default Value: in case we leave this element blank, all the fields which are successor to this would be keep blank.
Addl > addl [Optional] : information for additional component.
Name of this element in the record: ???
Valid Values: this element has many children each must have name <element> (except metadata element <type>) otherwise they will simply be ignored during creation of the record process.
Default Value: Ignored.
Addl-manufacturer[optional] : The name of manufacturer who had made the additional component.
Name of this element in the record: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Addl-name [Optional] : the name of additional component.
Name of this element in the record: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Addl-type [Optional]: the type of additional component.
Name of this element in the record: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Addl-description[Optional] : the description of the additional component.
Name of this element in the record: ???
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Scans [Optional:
Note: all the successor elements of this element NON-EXISTING.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
NOTE: each element show one row.
Scan-date [Optional] : The scan date.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
Default value: Ignored.
Scan-type [Optional] : the type of scan.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Scan-version: The version information of the scanner.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values:
Scan-result[Optional]: The scan result.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Support-contacts [Optional]: It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
support-contact-name [Optional] : The name of support contact.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > Contact Name
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Support-contact-reason [Optional] : the reason field in the contact.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > reason
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Support-contact-first [Optional] : A field for contact information.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > First Name
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Support-contact-last [Optional]: A filed for contact information.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > Last Name
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Support-contact-phone [Optional]: the phone number for the contact.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > Phone No
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Support-contact-email [Optional]: the email id information for the contact.
Name of this field in the application: Contact > E-mail
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Feature [Optional] :
Note: all the successor elements of this element are NON-EXISTING.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Feature-id [optional]: the feature id.
Name of this field in the application: ???
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Feature-size [optional]: feature size.
Name of this field in the application: ???
Valid Value: Any decimal value.
Default Value: Ignored.
Feature-description [optional]: the description of the feature.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
telecommunication-device[Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Configuration-item [Optional]: see configuration-item given above.
Drivers[Optional]:
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
Note: all the successor elements of this element NON-EXISTING.
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Driver-name[Optional]: The driver’s name.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Driver-type[Optional]: The driver’s type.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Driver-description[Optional]: The driver’s description.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Driver-version[Optional]: The driver’s version.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connections [Optional]: The connection information. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like- Note: all the successor elements of this element NON-EXISTING.
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Connection-name[Optional]: the name of connection.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connection-type[Optional]: the connection type.
Name of this elemnt in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connection-ip-address[Optional]: the ip address of the for the connection.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connection-mac-address[Optional]: the mac address.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connection-domain-suffix[Optional]: The domain name suffix.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default value: Ignored.
Connection-default-gateway[Optional]: The default Gateway.
Name of this element in the application: ???.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connection-subnet-mask[Optional]: the subnet mask.
Name of this element in the application: ???.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connection-device-id[Optional]: The id of device.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
connection-dhcp [Optional] : tell whether dhcp is enabled or not.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.). True -> DHCP is enabled. False -> DHCP is not enabled.
Default Value: false, i.e., DHCP is not enabled.
Connection-description[Optional]: Connection Description.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connection-speed[Optional]: the speed of the connection in Kbps (kilo bits per second)
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Speed (Kbps)
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value: Ignored.
Connection-media-interface[Optional]: number of media interfaces.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value: Ignored.
Ports[Optional]: Note: all the successor elements of this element NON-EXISTING.
It holds port information. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Port-name[Optional]: The name of the port.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Port-level[Optional]: Level to the port.
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Port-connectivity [Optional]: the connectivity information (serial or parallel).
Name of this element in the application: ???
Valid Values: Ideally it should have been value either parallel or serial, but however, you can put any string to it. Like “xyz123.”
Default Value: Ignored.
Sysmodtime [Optional]: The system time.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
Default Value: Ignored.
Sysmoduser [Optional]: (Not Writable) The system user.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Sysmodcount [Optional]: some count.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value: Ignored.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Update Telecommunication Device
This wrapper updates Telecommunication Device record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
